testcase.name: shouldStoreEncryptedPassword

failure.message:
Misplaced argument matcher detected here: -> at com.pillartech.blog.AccountTest.shouldStoreEncryptedPassword(AccountTest.java:19)
You cannot use argument matchers outside of verification or stubbing. Examples of correct usage of argument matchers: when(mock.get(anyInt())).thenReturn(null); doThrow(new RuntimeException()).when(mock).someVoidMethod(anyObject()); verify(mock).someMethod(contains("foo"))
Also, this error might show up because you use argument matchers with methods that cannot be mocked. Following methods *cannot* be stubbed/verified: final/private/equals()/hashCode() methods.
